00041 void
00042 DOMString::operator=(const char *c) {
00043         deleteascii();
00044         // determine the number of bytes needed
00045         int len = mbstowcs(NULL,c,0)+1;
00046         data.resize(len-1);
00047         wchar_t *d = (wchar_t *)data.c_str();
00048         mbstowcs(d, c, len);
00049 }
00050 const char *
00051 DOMString::utf8() const {
00052         if (cs) return cs;
00053         // determine the number of bytes needed
00054         int len = wcstombs(NULL, data.c_str(), 0) + 1;
00055         cs = new char[len];
00056         wcstombs(cs, data.c_str(), len);
00057         return cs;
00058 }

00151 void
00152 DOMString::resolveEntities() {
00153         deleteascii();
00154         int p1=0;
00155         int p2=-1;
00156         do {
00157                 p1 = find('&',p1);
00158                 if (p1 != -1) {
00159                         p2 = find(';', p1);
00160                         if (p2 != -1) {
00161                                 DOMString ent = substr(p1+1, p2-p1-1);
00162                                 wchar_t uni = MMLDict::resolveEntity(ent);
00163                                 if (uni) {
00164                                         ent = "&"+ent+";";
00165                                         replace(ent, uni);
00166                                         p1 = -1; // start from the beginning
00167                                 }
00168                         }
00169                 } else {
00170                         p2 = -1;
00171                 }
00172                 ++p1;
00173         } while (p2 != -1);
00174 }

00200     if (p == std::wstring::npos) {
00201         return -1;

00206 int
00207 DOMString::find(const DOMString &d, uint offset) const {
00208     uint p = data.find(d.data, offset);
00209     if (p == std::wstring::npos) {
00210         return -1;
00211     } else {
00212         return p;
00213     }
00214 }
00215 void
00216 DOMString::replace(DOMString d, wchar_t c) {
00217         deleteascii();
00218         int pos = find(d);
00219         uint dlen = d.data.size();
00220         while (pos != -1) {
00221                 DOMString nd = substr(0, pos);
00222                 nd += c;
00223                 nd += substr(pos+dlen);
00224                 this->data = nd.data;
00225                 pos = find(d);
00226         }
00227 }
00228 /*In MathML, as in XML, "whitespace" means blanks, tabs, newlines, or carriage returns, i.e. characters with hexadecimal Unicode codes U+0020, U+0009, U+000a, or U+000d, respectively.
00229 All whitespace at the beginning and end is removed. All other whitespace
00230 sequences are replaced with one space.*/
00231 void
00232 DOMString::normalize() {
00233         deleteascii();
00234         bool start = true;
00235         bool white = false;
00236         std::wstring d;
00237         std::wstring::const_iterator i;
00238         for (i=data.begin(); i != data.end(); ++i) {
00239                 if (isWhitespace(*i)) {
00240                         white = true;
00241                 } else {
00242                         if (white && !start) {
00243                                 d.push_back(' ');
00244                         }
00245                         white = start = false;
00246                         d.push_back(*i);
00247                 }
00248         }
00249         data = d;
00250 }
00251 bool
00252 DOMString::isWhitespace(wchar_t u) {
00253         return u == 0x0020 || u == 0x0009 || u == 0x000A || u == 0x000D;
00254 }
00255 DOMString
00256 DOMString::number(int i) {
00257         char buffer[16];
00258         snprintf(buffer, 16, "%i", i);
00259         DOMString d(buffer);
00260         return d;
00261 }
